articles.description: Follow live text and radio commentary as Manchester Originals face Birmingham Phoenix in the 2023 Men's Hundred.
articles.title: The Hundred: Moeen returns for Phoenix against Originals - radio & text

articles.description: Watch live coverage from fifth day of the 2023 Cycling World Championships in Glasgow.
articles.title: Watch: 2023 Cycling World Championships

articles.description: England go agonisingly close to an early exit from the Women's World Cup but find a way to win as the Lionesses' title dream lives on.
articles.title: Stumbling England ride their luck and find way to win

articles.description: Tottenham rejects Bayern Munich's latest offer for Harry Kane, with the two clubs apart on their valuation of the striker.
articles.title: Spurs reject latest Bayern Munich offer for Kane

articles.description: Watch highlights as England scrape through to the quarter-finals of the Women's World Cup with a dramatic penalty shootout victory over Nigeria despite Lauren James' red card.
articles.title: 'Daylight robbery' England win shootout to make quarters

articles.description: Lauren James "in a split-second lost her emotions" says boss Sarina Wiegman as England beat Nigeria on penalties in the Women's World Cup.
articles.title: James lost her emotions for red card, says Wiegman

articles.description: England coach Steve Borthwick says players' versatility was an "important aspect" of his World Cup squad selection.
articles.title: Positional 'flexibility' key to England selection

articles.description: West Ham are keen on Manchester United pair Harry Maguire and Scott McTominay, while Gianluca Scamacca leaves the club to join Atalanta.
articles.title: West Ham eye Maguire & McTominay as Scamacca leaves

articles.description: Kieran Reilly won the men's elite BMX freestyle park to get Great Britain's first gold medal of day five and claim his first world title.
articles.title: 'Pure joy' - GB's Reilly wins thrilling BMX freestyle gold

articles.description: Former dual-code England international Sam Burgess will take over as head coach of Warrington Wolves from the 2024 season onwards.
articles.title: Ex-England star Burgess to coach Warrington in 2024
